name: dog
definition: a member of the genus Canis (probably descended from the common wolf) that has been domesticated by man since prehistoric times; occurs in many breeds

children.name: basenji
children.definition: small smooth-haired breed of African origin having a tightly curled tail and the inability to bark

children.name: corgi
children.definition: either of two Welsh breeds of long-bodied short-legged dogs with erect ears and a fox-like head

children.name: cur
children.definition: an inferior dog or one of mixed breed

children.name: feist
children.definition: a nervous belligerent little mongrel dog

children.name: pariah dog
children.definition: ownerless half-wild mongrel dog common around Asian villages especially India

children.name: dalmatian
children.definition: a large breed having a smooth white coat with black or brown spots; originated in Dalmatia

children.name: great pyrenees
children.definition: bred of large heavy-coated white dogs resembling the Newfoundland

children.name: griffon
children.definition: breed of various very small compact wiry-coated dogs of Belgian origin having a short bearded muzzle

children.name: hunting dog
children.definition: a dog used in hunting game

children.name: courser
children.definition: a dog trained for coursing

children.name: dachshund
children.definition: small long-bodied short-legged German breed of dog having a short sleek coat and long drooping ears; suited for following game into burrows

children.name: hound
children.definition: any of several breeds of dog used for hunting typically having large drooping ears

children.name: afghan hound
children.definition: tall graceful breed of hound with a long silky coat; native to the Near East

children.name: basset
children.definition: smooth-haired breed of hound with short legs and long ears

children.name: beagle
children.definition: a small short-legged smooth-coated breed of hound

children.name: bloodhound
children.definition: a breed of large powerful hound of European origin having very acute smell and used in tracking

children.name: coonhound
children.definition: any of several breeds of hound developed for hunting raccoons

children.name: black-and-tan coonhound
children.definition: American breed of large powerful hound dogs used for hunting raccoons and other game

children.name: coondog
children.definition: any dog trained to hunt raccoons

children.name: greyhound
children.definition: a tall slender dog of an ancient breed noted for swiftness and keen sight; used as a racing dog

children.name: italian greyhound
children.definition: a toy dog developed from the greyhound

children.name: whippet
children.definition: small slender dog of greyhound type developed in England

children.name: ibizan hound
children.definition: breed of slender agile medium-sized hound found chiefly in the Balearic Islands; said to have been bred originally by the Pharaohs of ancient Egypt

children.name: norwegian elkhound
children.definition: breed of compact medium-sized dog with a heavy grey coat developed in Norway for hunting elk

children.name: saluki
children.definition: old breed of tall swift keen-eyed hunting dogs resembling greyhounds; from Egypt and southwestern Asia

children.name: scottish deerhound
children.definition: very large and tall rough-coated dog bred for hunting deer; known as the royal dog of Scotland

children.name: weimaraner
children.definition: large breed of hound having a smooth greyish coat; originated in Germany

children.name: wolfhound
children.definition: the largest breed of dogs; formerly used to hunt wolves

children.name: borzoi
children.definition: tall fast-moving dog breed

children.name: irish wolfhound
children.definition: large breed of hound with a rough thick coat

children.name: rhodesian ridgeback
children.definition: a powerful short-haired African hunting dog having a crest of reversed hair along the spine

children.name: sporting dog
children.definition: a dog trained to work with sportsmen when they hunt with guns

children.name: bird dog
children.definition: a gun dog trained to locate or retrieve birds

children.name: griffon
children.definition: breed of medium-sized long-headed dogs with downy undercoat and harsh wiry outer coat; originated in Holland but largely developed in France

children.name: pointer
children.definition: a strong slender smooth-haired dog of Spanish origin having a white coat with brown or black patches; scents out and points to game

children.name: german short-haired pointer
children.definition: liver or liver-and-white hunting dog developed in Germany; 3/4 pointer and 1/4 bloodhound

children.name: vizsla
children.definition: Hungarian hunting dog resembling the Weimaraner but having a rich deep red coat

children.name: retriever
children.definition: a dog with heavy water-resistant coat that can be trained to retrieve game

children.name: chesapeake bay retriever
children.definition: American breed having a short thick oily coat ranging from brown to light tan

children.name: curly-coated retriever
children.definition: an English breed having a tightly curled black or liver-colored coat; retrieves game from land or water

children.name: flat-coated retriever
children.definition: an English breed having a shiny black or liver-colored coat; retrieves game from land or water

children.name: golden retriever
children.definition: an English breed having a long silky golden coat

children.name: labrador retriever
children.definition: breed originally from Labrador having a short black or golden-brown coat

children.name: setter
children.definition: a long-haired dog formerly trained to crouch on finding game but now to point

children.name: english setter
children.definition: an English breed having a plumed tail and a soft silky coat that is chiefly white

children.name: gordon setter
children.definition: a Scottish breed with a black-and-tan coat

children.name: irish setter
children.definition: an Irish breed with a chestnut-brown or mahogany-red coat

children.name: spaniel
children.definition: any of several breeds of small to medium-sized gun dogs with a long silky coat and long frilled ears

children.name: brittany spaniel
children.definition: tall active short-tailed French breed of bird dog having a usually smooth orange- or liver-and-white coat

children.name: cocker spaniel
children.definition: a small breed with wavy silky hair; originally developed in England

children.name: sussex spaniel
children.definition: an English breed with short legs and a golden liver-colored coat

children.name: water spaniel
children.definition: any dog of two large curly-coated breeds used for hunting waterfowl

children.name: american water spaniel
children.definition: breed of medium-sized spaniels originating in America having chocolate or liver-colored curly coat

children.name: irish water spaniel
children.definition: breed of large spaniels developed in Ireland having a heavy coat of liver-colored curls and a topknot of long curls and a nearly hairless tail

children.name: water dog
children.definition: a dog accustomed to water and usually trained to retrieve waterfowl

children.name: terrier
children.definition: any of several usually small short-bodied breeds originally trained to hunt animals living underground

children.name: airedale
children.definition: breed of large wiry-coated terrier bred in Yorkshire

children.name: australian terrier
children.definition: small greyish wire-haired breed of terrier from Australia similar to the cairn

children.name: boston bull
children.definition: small pug-faced American terrier breed having a smooth brindle or black coat with white markings

children.name: bullterrier
children.definition: a powerful short-haired terrier originated in England by crossing the bulldog with terriers

children.name: american staffordshire terrier
children.definition: American breed of muscular terriers with a short close-lying stiff coat

children.name: staffordshire bullterrier
children.definition: English breed of strong stocky dog having a broad skull and smooth coat

children.name: cairn
children.definition: small rough-haired breed of terrier from Scotland

children.name: dandie dinmont
children.definition: a breed of small terrier with long wiry coat and drooping ears

children.name: irish terrier
children.definition: medium-sized breed with a wiry brown coat; developed in Ireland

children.name: kerry blue terrier
children.definition: an Irish breed of medium-sized terriers with a silky blue-grey coat

children.name: lhasa
children.definition: a breed of terrier having a long heavy coat raised in Tibet as watchdogs

children.name: norfolk terrier
children.definition: English breed of small terrier with a straight wiry grizzled coat and dropped ears

children.name: norwich terrier
children.definition: English breed of small short-legged terrier with a straight wiry red or grey or black-and-tan coat and erect ears

children.name: rat terrier
children.definition: any of several breeds of terrier developed to catch rats

children.name: manchester terrier
children.definition: a breed of short-haired rat terrier with a black-and-tan coat that was developed in Manchester, England

children.name: toy manchester
children.definition: breed of small Manchester terrier

children.name: schnauzer
children.definition: old German breed of sturdy black or greyish wire-haired terriers having a blunt muzzle ranging in size from fairly small to very large; used as ratters and guard dogs or police dogs

children.name: scotch terrier
children.definition: old Scottish breed of small long-haired usually black terrier with erect tail and ears

children.name: silky terrier
children.definition: Australian breed of toy dogs having a silky blue coat

children.name: skye terrier
children.definition: Scottish breed of terrier with shaggy hair and long low body with short legs; native to the Isle of Skye

children.name: soft-coated wheaten terrier
children.definition: Irish breed of medium-sized terrier with an abundant coat any shade of wheat and very hairy head and muzzle

children.name: tibetan terrier
children.definition: breed of medium-sized terriers bred in Tibet resembling Old English sheepdogs with fluffy curled tails

children.name: yorkshire terrier
children.definition: very small breed having a long glossy coat of bluish-grey and tan

children.name: lapdog
children.definition: a dog small and tame enough to be held in the lap

children.name: leonberg
children.definition: a large dog (usually with a golden coat) produced by crossing a St Bernard and a Newfoundland

children.name: mexican hairless
children.definition: any of an old breed of small nearly hairless dogs of Mexico

children.name: newfoundland
children.definition: a breed of very large heavy dogs with a thick coarse usually black coat; highly intelligent dogs and vigorous swimmers; developed in Newfoundland

children.name: pooch
children.definition: informal terms for dogs

children.name: poodle
children.definition: an intelligent dog with a heavy curly solid-colored coat that is usually clipped; an old breed sometimes trained as sporting dogs or as performing dogs

children.name: large poodle
children.definition: the largest breed of poodle

children.name: miniature poodle
children.definition: a breed of small poodles

children.name: standard poodle
children.definition: a breed or medium-sized poodles

children.name: toy poodle
children.definition: the breed of very small poodles

children.name: pug
children.definition: small compact smooth-coated breed of Asiatic origin having a tightly curled tail and broad flat wrinkled muzzle

children.name: puppy
children.definition: a young dog

children.name: spitz
children.definition: any of various stocky heavy-coated breeds of dogs native to northern regions having pointed muzzles and erect ears with a curled furry tail

children.name: chow
children.definition: breed of medium-sized dogs with a thick coat and fluffy curled tails and distinctive blue-black tongues; believed to have originated in northern China

children.name: keeshond
children.definition: a spitz-like dog having a shaggy greyish coat and tightly curled tail originating in Holland

children.name: pomeranian
children.definition: breed of very small compact long-haired dogs of the spitz type

children.name: samoyed
children.definition: Siberian breed of white or cream-colored dog of the spitz family

children.name: toy dog
children.definition: any of several breeds of very small dogs kept purely as pets

children.name: chihuahua
children.definition: an old breed of tiny short-haired dog with protruding eyes from Mexico held to antedate Aztec civilization

children.name: japanese spaniel
children.definition: breed of toy dogs originating in Japan having a silky black-and-white or red-and-white coat

children.name: maltese dog
children.definition: breed of toy dogs having a long straight silky white coat

children.name: pekinese
children.definition: a Chinese breed of small short-legged dogs with a long silky coat and broad flat muzzle

children.name: shih-tzu
children.definition: a Chinese breed of small dog similar to a Pekingese

children.name: toy terrier
children.definition: a small active dog

children.name: working dog
children.definition: any of several breeds of usually large powerful dogs bred to work as draft animals and guard and guide dogs

children.name: boxer
children.definition: a breed of stocky medium-sized short-haired dog with a brindled coat and square-jawed muzzle developed in Germany

children.name: bull mastiff
children.definition: large powerful breed developed by crossing the bulldog and the mastiff

children.name: bulldog
children.definition: a sturdy thickset short-haired breed with a large head and strong undershot lower jaw; developed originally in England for bull baiting

children.name: french bulldog
children.definition: small stocky version of the bulldog having a sleek coat and square head

children.name: eskimo dog
children.definition: breed of heavy-coated Arctic sled dog

children.name: great dane
children.definition: very large powerful smooth-coated breed of dog

children.name: guide dog
children.definition: a dog trained to guide the blind

children.name: seeing eye dog
children.definition: (trademark) a guide dog trained to guide a blind person

children.name: hearing dog
children.definition: dog trained to assist the deaf by signaling the occurrence of certain sounds

children.name: mastiff
children.definition: an old breed of powerful deep-chested smooth-coated dog used chiefly as a watchdog and guard dog

children.name: tibetan mastiff
children.definition: very large powerful rough-coated dog native to central Asia

children.name: police dog
children.definition: any dog trained to assist police especially in tracking

children.name: saint bernard
children.definition: a Swiss alpine breed of large powerful dog with a thick coat of hair used as a rescue dog

children.name: seizure-alert dog
children.definition: a dog that can alert or assist people with seizure disorders

children.name: sennenhunde
children.definition: any of four Swiss breeds

children.name: appenzeller
children.definition: a smaller of the four Swiss breeds

children.name: bernese mountain dog
children.definition: large powerful long-haired black-coated Swiss dog with deep tan or russet markings on legs and white blaze and feet and chest marking; formerly used for draft

children.name: greater swiss mountain dog
children.definition: the largest of the four Swiss breeds

children.name: shepherd dog
children.definition: any of various usually long-haired breeds of dog reared to herd and guard sheep

children.name: belgian sheepdog
children.definition: hardy working dog developed in Belgium for herding sheep

children.name: groenendael
children.definition: black-coated sheepdog with a heavily plumed tail

children.name: malinois
children.definition: fawn-colored short-haired sheepdog

children.name: bouvier des flandres
children.definition: rough-coated breed used originally in Belgium for herding and guarding cattle

children.name: briard
children.definition: old French breed of large strong usually black dogs having a long tail and long wavy and slightly stiff coat

children.name: collie
children.definition: a silky-coated sheepdog with a long ruff and long narrow head developed in Scotland

children.name: german shepherd
children.definition: breed of large shepherd dogs used in police work and as a guide for the blind

children.name: kelpie
children.definition: an Australian sheepdog with pointed ears

children.name: komondor
children.definition: Hungarian breed of large powerful shaggy-coated white dog; used also as guard dog

children.name: old english sheepdog
children.definition: large sheepdog with a profuse shaggy bluish-grey-and-white coat and short tail; believed to trace back to the Roman occupation of Britain

children.name: rottweiler
children.definition: German breed of large vigorous short-haired cattle dogs

children.name: shetland sheepdog
children.definition: a small sheepdog resembling a collie that was developed in the Shetland Islands

children.name: sled dog
children.definition: a dog trained to draw a sled usually in a team

children.name: malamute
children.definition: breed of sled dog developed in Alaska

children.name: siberian husky
children.definition: breed of sled dog developed in northeastern Siberia; they resemble the larger Alaskan malamutes

children.name: watchdog
children.definition: a dog trained to guard property

children.name: attack dog
children.definition: a watchdog trained to attack on command

children.name: housedog
children.definition: a dog trained to guard a house

children.name: kuvasz
children.definition: long-established Hungarian breed of tall light-footed but sturdy white dog; used also as a hunting dog

children.name: pinscher
children.definition: any of three breeds of dogs whose ears and tail are usually cropped

children.name: affenpinscher
children.definition: European breed of small dog resembling a terrier with dark wiry hair and a tufted muzzle

children.name: doberman
children.definition: medium large breed of dog of German origin with a glossy black and tan coat; used as a watchdog

children.name: schipperke
children.definition: breed of small stocky black dogs originally used as watchdogs on boats in the Netherlands and Belgium
